intro: Styrax grandifolius, commonly known as the large-leaved styrax, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to eastern Asia. It is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves that are typically 5–10 cm in length. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant, white flowers in the spring, which are followed by dark purple, waxy berries. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Styrax grandifolius is valued in horticulture for its ornamental foliage and floral display.
